content:
Your task is to create a concise running summary of actions and information results in the provided text, focusing on key and potentially important information to remember.

You will receive the current summary and the your latest actions. Combine them, adding relevant key information from the latest development in 1st person past tense and keeping the summary concise.

Summary So Far:
"""
{'role': 'system', 'content': 'This reminds you of these events from your past: \nAs a system, I previously received a command to read "README.md" in the directory "/home/atlas/autogpt/auto_gpt_workspace/halflife-regression". The command returned information about Half-Life Regression, including a link to the paper that introduced it, a description of the software used to implement it, and a data set available for download. As a user, I also read "lexeme_reference.txt" and received a list of lexemes and their attributes. In the latest development, I received a command to Google the "best language learning resources". The command returned a list of websites, including "https://www.theintrepidguide.com/top-language-learning-resources/", "https://www.businessinsider.com/guides/learning/best-online-apps-courses-to-learn-new-language", "https://www.alllanguageresources.com/", "https://www.quora.com/What-are-the-best-language-learning-resources", "https://www.lingualift.com/blog/best-language-learning-resources/", "https://nymag.com/strategist/article/how-to-learn-languages-at-home.html", "https://www.mezzoguild.com/tools/", and "https://www.fluentu.com/blog/online-language-learning-for-kids/". I then received a command to browse the website "https://www.theintrepidguide.com/top-language-learning-resources/" and find out what the top language learning resources are. The command browse_website returned: Answer gathered from website: The text provides a list of language learning resources including apps like Mondly, uTalk, Glossika, Busuu, Duolingo, Memrise, and LingQ, online language-learning programs like Babbel and LinguaLift, language exchange mobile apps like Tandem, audio courses like Michel Thomas and Pimsleur, and podcasts like Coffee Break Languages and Bite-Size Immersive Audio Courses by Actual Fluency. The author also recommends using italki and LanguaTalk to connect with expert teachers for language learning.'}
"""

Latest Development:
"""
[{'role': 'you', 'content': '{"command": {"name": "write_to_file", "args": {"filename": "language_learning_resources.txt", "text": "The Intrepid Guide\'s Top Language Learning Resources:\\n\\n- Mondly\\n- uTalk\\n- Glossika\\n- Busuu\\n- Duolingo\\n- Memrise\\n- LingQ\\n- Babbel\\n- LinguaLift\\n- Tandem\\n- Michel Thomas\\n- Pimsleur\\n- Coffee Break Languages\\n- Bite-Size Immersive Audio Courses by Actual Fluency\\n- italki\\n- LanguaTalk"}}}'}]
"""
